item.title: 股市受美国经济衰退担忧影响，债券为降息定价
item.description: 周一，亚洲主要股指全线飘红，原因是市场担心美国可能会走向衰退，从而引发了大规模的避险情绪，同时也在赌利率必须迅速大幅下降，以支持经济增长。【原文：Major share indices were deep in the red in Asia on Monday as fears the United States could be heading for recession triggered mass risk aversion and wagers interest rates will have to fall sharply, and quickly, to support growth.】

item.title: 早间竞标再见软着陆，你好紧急着陆
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 美国将提议禁止在自动驾驶汽车中使用中国软件
item.description: 据知情人士透露，美国商务部预计将在未来几周内提议禁止中国软件在自动驾驶和联网汽车中使用。【原文：The U.S. Commerce Department is expected to propose barring Chinese software in autonomous and connected vehicles in the coming weeks, according to sources briefed on the matter.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称士力架制造商玛氏正在探索收购凯乐诺华
item.description: 鉴于 Kellanova 公司 220 亿美元的市值，这笔交易将成为包装食品行业有史以来最大的交易之一，同时也是对美国监管机构允许该行业进行整合的胃口的一次考验。【原文：A deal would be one of the biggest ever in the packaged food sector, given Kellanova's market value of $22 billion, and test the appetite of U.S. regulators to allow consolidation in the sector.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称士力架制造商玛氏正在探索收购凯乐诺华
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，家族食品巨头玛氏公司（旗下糖果品牌包括 M&M's 和士力架）正在探索收购 Kellanova 公司的可能性，该公司是 Cheez-It 和 Pringles 等零食的制造商。【原文：Family-owned food giant Mars, whose candy brands include M&M's and Snickers, is exploring a potential acquisition of Kellanova , maker of snacks such as Cheez-It and Pringles, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克称美联储不降息很愚蠢
item.description: 亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周日表示，美联储需要降息，美国央行不降息是愚蠢的。【原文：Billionaire Elon Musk said on Sunday the Federal Reserve needs to cut interest rates and that it was foolish for the U.S. central bank not to have done so already.】

item.title: 比特币下跌 5.69% 至 58,987 美元
item.description: 北京时间周日15:58，比特币下跌5.69%，至58,987美元。【原文：Bitcoin fell 5.69% to $58,987 at 15:58 GMT on Sunday.】

item.title: 大跌之后，全球股票交易者面临逢低买入的困境
item.description: 震撼全球股市的大跌给那些希望低价买入股票的投资者的前景蒙上了一层阴影，因为对美国经济的担忧和令人失望的科技股收益威胁着未来更多的损失。【原文：A selloff that rocked equity markets around the world is clouding the outlook for investors looking to buy stocks on the cheap, as worries over the U.S. economy and disappointing tech earnings threaten more losses ahead.】

item.title: 信息》称，英伟达新人工智能芯片的延迟可能会影响微软、谷歌和 Meta
item.description: 科技媒体《信息》周五称，设计缺陷可能导致芯片巨头英伟达（Nvidia）即将推出的人工智能芯片推迟三个月或更长时间上市。【原文：Design flaws could cause a delay of three months or more in the launch of chip giant Nvidia's upcoming artificial-intelligence chips, tech-focused publication the Information said on Friday.】

item.title: 据《金融时报》报道，Abrdn 财务总监 Jason Windsor 将接替 Stephen Bird 担任首席执行官
item.description: 据《金融时报》周六报道，在斯蒂芬-伯德（Stephen Bird）离职后，Abrdn 财务总监杰森-温莎（Jason Windsor）成为英国基金管理公司下一任首席执行官的最热门人选。【原文：Abrdn finance chief Jason Windsor is the front-runner to become the next chief executive of the British fund manager following the departure of Stephen Bird, the Financial Times reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 巴菲特减持苹果股份，伯克希尔现金达到 2770 亿美元，营业利润创历史新高
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）似乎已经对股票失去兴趣，他让伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）的现金飙升至近 2,770 亿美元，并出售了其在苹果公司（Apple）的大部分股份，即使这家企业集团公布了创纪录的季度营业利润。【原文：Warren Buffett appears to have soured on stocks, letting cash at Berkshire Hathaway soar to nearly $277 billion and selling a large chunk of its stake in Apple , even as the conglomerate posted a record quarterly operating profit.】

item.title: 巴菲特撤出股票，伯克希尔现金达到 2,770 亿美元；营业利润创下历史新高
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）似乎已经对股票失去了兴趣，他让伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）的现金飙升至近 2,770 亿美元，即使这家企业集团公布了其数十家运营企业创纪录的季度利润。【原文：Warren Buffett appears to have soured on stocks, letting cash at Berkshire Hathaway soar to nearly $277 billion even as the conglomerate posted a record quarterly profit from its dozens of operating businesses.】

item.title: 硅谷银行前所有者获准结束破产程序
item.description: 倒闭的硅谷银行的前所有者 SVB 金融集团周五获得美国法官的许可，将其资产移交给债权人并结束破产。【原文：SVB Financial Group, the former owner of failed Silicon Valley Bank, received a U.S. judge's permission on Friday to turn over its assets to creditors and end its bankruptcy.】

item.title: 美联储主席巴尔金在公共广播公司节目中表示，他不会预先判断下一次会议将采取什么行动
item.description: 里士满联储主席托马斯-巴尔金（Thomas Barkin）表示，在周五公布了意外疲软的美国就业数据后，他还不准备改变其货币政策前景，即使华尔街转向了积极降息的预期。【原文：Richmond Federal Reserve President Thomas Barkin said he is not ready to change his monetary policy outlook after the release of unexpectedly weak U.S. jobs data on Friday, even as Wall Street shifted toward expectations of aggressive interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 高盛称，对冲基金在经济放缓的忧虑中逐渐看跌
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）在给客户的一份说明中说，截至8月1日的一周里，全球对冲基金继续在投资组合中增加看跌股票的押注，因为新的数据引发了对美国经济放缓速度超过预期的担忧。【原文：Global hedge funds continued to add bearish equity bets to portfolios in the week to Aug. 1 when fresh data sparked fears the U.S. economy is slowing faster than anticipated, Goldman Sachs said in a note to clients.】

item.title: 50 多名美国议员和 21 个州在 TikTok 诉讼案中支持司法部
item.description: 美国 21 个州和 50 多名立法者周五支持司法部为一项法律辩护，该法律要求总部位于中国的字节跳动公司在 1 月 19 日前出售 TikTok 在美国的资产，否则将面临禁令。【原文：A group of 21 states and more than 50 U.S. lawmakers on Friday backed the Justice Department in its defense of a law that requires China-based ByteDance to sell TikTok's U.S. assets by Jan. 19 or face a ban.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚央行技术团队将 2024 年通胀展望上调至 5.7
item.description: 哥伦比亚中央银行技术小组在周五公布的一份季度报告中称，该行将今年的通胀预期从之前的 5.5% 下调至 5.7。【原文：The technical team of Colombia's central bank revised its inflation outlook for the year to 5.7, from a previous 5.5%, it said in a quarterly report published on Friday.】

item.title: 摩根大通考虑就 Zelle 起诉消费者监督机构
item.description: 摩根大通周五表示，正在考虑是否就对 Zelle 支付应用的调查起诉美国政府消费者监督机构。【原文：JPMorgan Chase said on Friday it is considering whether to sue a U.S. government consumer watchdog over inquiries into the Zelle payment app.】

item.title: 受疲软电影阵容影响，AMC 娱乐公司第二季度转入亏损
item.description: AMC Entertainment Holdings 第二季度出现亏损，而去年同期则实现盈利，原因是去年好莱坞双罢工的影响仍未消除，导致主要影院上映的影片数量有限。【原文：AMC Entertainment Holdings posted a loss for the second quarter compared to a profit in the same period last year hurt by the lingering impact of last year's dual Hollywood strikes, which led to a limited number of major theatrical releases.】

item.title: 就业报告疲软，华尔街认为 2024 年美联储将加大宽松力度
item.description: 一份出人意料地疲软的美国 6 月份就业报告，使华尔街对经济软着陆的信心转变为对经济衰退迫在眉睫的近乎恐慌，促使各大公司改变了对美联储今年宽松政策的预测，转而采取更激进的降息措施。【原文：A surprisingly weak U.S. employment report for June has turned Wall Street confidence on a soft landing into near panic that a recession is looming, prompting major firms to change forecasts for Federal Reserve easing this year to more aggressive interest rate cutting.】

item.title: 美国经济衰退恐慌助推债券飙升，收益率曲线翻转在望
item.description: 美国降息预期的急剧重新定价可能会给因经济数据疲软而引发的债券大涨火上浇油，因为投资者正在努力应对美联储可能需要以比预期快得多的速度放松对经济的严格控制，以避免经济衰退。【原文：A sharp repricing in U.S. interest rate cut expectations could give more fuel to a searing bond rally triggered by weakening economic data, as investors grapple with the possibility the Federal Reserve may need to loosen its tight grip on the economy much faster than anticipated to avoid a recession.】

item.title: 美联储古尔斯比：不希望 "击穿 "充分就业
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长奥斯坦-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周五表示，美国央行应该以 "稳健 "的方式行事，这是对市场匆忙下注美联储将在9月份对7月份疲软的就业数据报告做出比通常幅度更大的半点降息反应的温和回击。【原文：Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Austan Goolsbee said on Friday the U.S. central bank should move in a "steady" way, a mild pushback against the rush of market bets that the Fed will react to a report of weak July jobs data with a bigger-than-usual half-point rate cut in September.】

item.title: 美国就业报告发布后，我们有四个理由喘口气
item.description: 令人失望的美国 7 月份就业报告引发了金融市场的 "疯狂星期五"，并引发了对美联储下月降息幅度预期的全面重置。【原文：The disappointing U.S. employment report for July unleashed a "Freakout Friday" moment in financial markets and triggered a wholesale resetting of expectations for how much the Federal Reserve might cut interest rates next month.】

item.title: 美国 FDA 称礼来公司所有剂量的减肥和糖尿病药物现已上市
item.description: 美国食品和药物管理局周五更新的短缺药品清单显示，礼来公司的减肥药Zepbound和糖尿病药Mounjaro的所有剂量现在都有供应。【原文：All doses of Eli Lilly's weight-loss drug Zepbound and diabetes drug Mounjaro are now available, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration's updated shortage list showed on Friday.】

item.title: 谷歌与 Character.AI 签订许可协议，并聘用其联合创始人
item.description: 聊天机器人制造商 Character.AI 表示，它已与 Alphabet 旗下的谷歌达成协议，允许谷歌获得 Character.AI 当前大型语言模型技术的非独家许可。【原文：Chatbot maker Character.AI said it has entered into an agreement with Alphabet's Google, allowing it a non-exclusive license for Character.AI's current large language model technology.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称，巴西国家石油公司对 Galp 纳米比亚勘探区的竞标将包括至少一个合作伙伴
item.description: 两位知情人士告诉路透社，巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）在竞购 Galp Energia 公司位于纳米比亚的 Mopane 石油勘探区 40% 的股份时，将至少包括一个合作伙伴。【原文：Brazil's Petrobras will include at least one partner in its bid for a 40% stake in Galp Energia's Mopane oil prospect in Namibia, two sources with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，数据提供商邓白氏正在探索出售事宜
item.description: 数据和分析服务提供商邓白氏公司（Dun & Bradstreet）市值近 80 亿美元（包括债务），该公司正在探索包括潜在出售在内的各种选择，熟悉此事的人士周五表示。【原文：Data and analytics provider Dun & Bradstreet , which has a market value of nearly $8 billion including debt, is exploring options including a potential sale, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.】

item.title: 独家报道伊坎支持的炼油厂与债权人集团在 Citgo 拍卖会上一决雌雄
item.description: 据三位熟知内情的人士透露，一家由激进投资者卡尔-伊坎（Carl Icahn）支持的炼油企业和一群持有对委内瑞拉债权的债权人正在美国法院拍卖 Citgo Petroleum 的最后一公里展开竞争。【原文：An oil refiner backed by activist investor Carl Icahn and a group of creditors holding claims against Venezuela are competing in the last mile of a U.S. court auction for Citgo Petroleum, according to three people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 专家回应股市抛售，纳斯达克指数走向修正
item.description: 周五，由于对经济的担忧以及亚马逊和英特尔公司的下调预测，全球股市遭到抛售，美国国债收益率也创下了数月来的新低，这对估值颇高的科技公司造成了冲击。【原文：Global equities sold off on Friday and U.S. Treasury yields were at multi-month lows on concerns about the economy and downbeat forecasts from Amazon and Intel, which hit richly-valued technology firms.】

item.title: 波动率挂钩基金抛售美股，加剧股市下跌
item.description: 美国股市的急剧下跌引发了对波动性敏感的基金的抛售，加剧了纳斯达克综合指数（Nasdaq Composite）已经进入调整区间的抛售。【原文：A sharp drop in U.S. stocks is provoking selling from volatility-sensitive funds, exacerbating a selloff that has already brought the Nasdaq Composite into correction territory.】
